channel.title: Init repo failed
channel.description:
After installing Axoloti Patcher and plugging in Axoloti Core for the first time, I am not able to get the Factory or Community libraries to sync with git. Preferences -> "Reset All" and Preferences -> Edit factory -> sync both give the errors below (plus a lot of additional java-related output I am skipping for brevity).
Troubleshooting suggestions greatly appreciated!
Kris Bergstrom Torrance CA USA
OS: Ubuntu Trusty (14.04) Axoloti software build version: 1.0.11-0-gc534986 (28/08/2016)
Link to firmware CRC 50A29AA2 Current user library does not match correct version master -> 1.0.11 Stash (stash) FAILED : community (1.0.11,anon) org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.NoHeadException: HEAD required to stash local changes ... Saving preferences... preferences path : /home/xuxa/axoloti/axoloti.prefs USB device found connected Authentic Axoloti Core Firmware version: 1.0.0.1, crc=0x50A29AA2, entrypoint=0x20011000 init repo FAILED : factory org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.TransportException: https://github.com/axoloti/axoloti-factory.git: cannot open git-upload-pack

item.title: Init repo failed
item.dc:creator: @xuxa Kristofer Bergstrom
item.description:
@xuxa wrote:

That was exactly it! I read that section but somehow didn't think it applied to me.

Thank you so much, Johannes... both for this help, but also for this whole project! I'm so excited to get started and to be a member of the Axoloti community!

Read full topic

item.title: Init repo failed
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Hi, check this topic, section "Important note"
that should resolve this.

Read full topic

@xuxa wrote:

After installing Axoloti Patcher and plugging in Axoloti Core for the first time, I am not able to get the Factory or Community libraries to sync with git. Preferences -> "Reset All" and Preferences -> Edit factory -> sync both give the errors below (plus a lot of additional java-related output I am skipping for brevity).

Troubleshooting suggestions greatly appreciated!

Kris Bergstrom
Torrance CA USA
